subject: Learning
title: Praise: Effort vs Intelligence
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Praise: Effort vs Intelligence.

hook.text: 'You're so smart!' feels like a compliment. It might actually be sabotage.

buildup.text: Dweck's research tested praising children for intelligence vs praising them for effort.

discovery.text: Kids praised for intelligence avoided hard problems. Kids praised for effort chose challenges.

twist.text: Intelligence praise makes failure feel like a verdict. Effort praise makes failure feel like a signal to try harder.

climax.text: The praised-for-intelligence group even lied about their scores to maintain the 'smart' label.

punchline.text: Praise the process, not the person.

quiz.question: What happened when children were praised for intelligence?
options: They avoided hard problems and feared failure
They became more resilient and persistent
They performed better on all future tests
